musicalLanguage.description: Built on a flowing arpeggiated pattern in A major, this arrangement captures the emotional weight of the original. The left hand rolls through broken chords while the right hand carries the vocal melody. The I-V-vi-IV progression drives the entire piece with understated power.
musicalLanguage.structure: Verse pattern (8 bars) — A-E-F#m-D progression repeated twice
keyMoments: Bars 1-2: A to E — the open, hopeful beginning
Bars 3-4: F#m to D — the emotional turn where melancholy enters
Bars 7-8: Second pass with slightly fuller texture, building intensity
teachingGoals: Smooth arpeggiated left-hand patterns across 4 chord shapes
Independent hand coordination — melody over flowing accompaniment
Expressive dynamics within a soft dynamic range
styleTips: The left hand should flow like water — even, unhurried eighth notes
Right-hand melody needs to breathe, like a singer taking breaths between phrases
Keep dynamics restrained — the power comes from the harmonic motion, not volume

measures.leftHand: A2:e E3:e A3:e E3:e A2:e E3:e A3:e E3:e
measures.teachingNote: A major arpeggiation — establish the rolling pattern that defines this song.

measures.leftHand: E2:e B2:e E3:e B2:e E2:e B2:e E3:e B2:e
measures.teachingNote: E major — the V chord. The melody rises to B4, opening up the phrase.

measures.leftHand: F#2:e C#3:e F#3:e C#3:e F#2:e C#3:e F#3:e C#3:e
measures.teachingNote: F# minor — the vi chord. Same melody shape but the harmony darkens beneath it.

measures.leftHand: D2:e A2:e D3:e A2:e D2:e A2:e D3:e A2:e
measures.teachingNote: D major — the IV chord. Melody descends to rest. Feel the sadness here.

measures.leftHand: A2:e E3:e A3:e E3:e A2:e E3:e A3:e E3:e
measures.teachingNote: Second verse pass — same chords, growing confidence.

measures.leftHand: E2:e B2:e E3:e B2:e E2:e B2:e E3:e B2:e
measures.teachingNote: This time the melody pushes higher to C#5 — building emotional intensity.

measures.leftHand: F#2:e C#3:e F#3:e C#3:e F#2:e C#3:e F#3:e C#3:e
measures.teachingNote: F# minor again — the melody lingers higher, more urgent.

measures.leftHand: D2:e A2:e D3:e A2:e A2:e E3:e A3:h
measures.teachingNote: D resolving to A — the melody drops to a quiet close. Let the last note fade.
